intro: Trichomanes spruceanum, commonly known as the Spruce Clubmoss, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Huperfamily. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories across temperate regions. Its sporophytes are small and inconspicuous, with spore-producing structures called sporangia located on the undersides of its leaves. Trichomanes spruceanum plays a role in maintaining soil stability and providing habitat for various microorganisms in its ecosystem.
